freenet.support
Class LoggerHookChain

java.lang.Object
  freenet.support.Logger
      freenet.support.LoggerHook
          freenet.support.LoggerHookChain

public class LoggerHookChain
extends LoggerHook

A class that takes logging messages and distributes them to LoggerHooks. It implements LoggerHook itself, so that instances can be chained (just don't create loops).

Method Detail

log

public void log(Object o,
                Class<?> c,
                String msg,
                Throwable e,
                int priority)
This is the implementation of LoggerHook method, which allows one logger receive events from another.

Specified by:
log in class LoggerHook
Parameters:
o - The object where this message was generated.
c - The class where this message was generated.
msg - A clear and verbose message describing the event
e - Logs this exception with the message.
priority - The priority of the mesage, one of Logger.ERROR, Logger.NORMAL, Logger.MINOR, or Logger.DEBUG.

setDetailedThresholds

public void setDetailedThresholds(String details)
                           throws LoggerHook.InvalidThresholdException
Description copied from class: Logger
Set the detailed list of thresholds. This allows to specify that we are interested in debug level logging for one class but are only interested in errors for another, which can be very useful for debugging. Format is classname:threshold,classname:threshold...

Overrides:
setDetailedThresholds in class LoggerHook
Throws:
LoggerHook.InvalidThresholdException

setThreshold

Description copied from class: Logger
Changes the priority threshold.

Overrides:
setThreshold in class LoggerHook
Parameters:
thresh - The new threshhold
